title: The new client I guess
body:
Got into a ranked match, game froze on champ select and couldn't lock in.
Lost 7 lp, oh well ok, 6min dodge penalty, reported bug.

Got into ranked match after that, game froze on my ban, lost 10lp
25 MINUTE PENALTY.

This right here is one of the biggest factors that A) I used to avoid ranked and B) I've been less and less frequent on league.
I reverted to the old client. I am so sick and tired of being punished for the game itself crashing, it's just league, I have no connection issues with anything else and I have already ruled out all of the factors aside from it just being the new client. I don't even really care about the LP that much anymore I'm just heated beyond belief that I have such a long penalty for the game itself freezing and not me dodging. I don't dodge, I never have, the handful of times I got a penalty ALL are from the game locking up or freezing.

replies.body: The updated client is still in testing so you can run into problems, and it's perfectly fine to stick to the legacy client for now if you want to play ranked matches.  We can't alter game stats or a [leaverbuster](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ) penalty, but I'm happy to help troubleshoot.  Are you freezing at the champion select screen or after?  What are you seeing exactly and are there any error messages?  How is it working out on the legacy client?  Just let me know!

the timer counts down to 0 and I can't do anything and then after some time it kicks me out of select and I have a leaverbuster penalty. is there a way to make it so that I only launch the legacy client? I'm going to avoid the new one like the plague because of how of often this happens.

It sounds like your network is going into a dormant state or cutting off, so it can't transition over to our game server.   Start off by running through the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot. This should help tighten up your connection and get you back in-game.
